flawed_nl_solution:
Jessica will drive 20 minutes, twice every school day (to and from school), so 20 minutes x 2 trips = <<20*2=40>>40 minutes each day.
There are 60 minutes in 1 hour, so 50 hours of driving x 60 minutes/hour = <<50*60=3000>>3000 minutes.
If you take the 3000 minutes she needs to drive / 40 minutes driving each day = <<3000/40=57.0>>57.0 school days to drive 50 hours.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 75.0, not 57.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
